David Estévez

Electronics Engineer with a M.Sc in Robotics. I am currently working on my Ph.D at University Carlos III of Madrid, researching about garment perception and manipulation applied to robotics (i.e. teaching a robot how to do the laundry). My research interests are Computer Vision, Robotics, and Mixed Reality applied to robots.

Contact me:

Robot Devastation

A Mixed-Reality game in which the player takes control of a real robot to fight against other robots with simulated weapons. Destruction is simulated... but fun is real!

  • More info: Link
  • Date: Ongoing project
  • Category: Software

Gecko

GECKO is a gesture recognition software that allows the user a basic control of the computer's cursor and click functionalities, as well as launching user-defined commands. It was implemented with my classmate Irene Sanz as our final work for a computer vision undergraduate course.

  • More info: Link
  • Date: January 2014
  • Category: Software

Shiva

Make a drumkit out of any object! Shiva is a DIY MIDI electronic drumkit. Using some piezoeletric sensors (exactly the same used in guitar tuners) it can detect when you hit an object, playing MIDI notes over USB or MIDI connector.

  • More info: Link
  • Date: Octubre 2015
  • Category: Hardware

ABBlind

ABBlind is a double-blind audio testing device that can be used to test audio equipment. With ABBlind you can compare two pieces of audio equipment to decide which one performs better. You can save money in audio equipment whose differences you are not able to perceive!

  • More info: Link
  • Date: Octubre 2015
  • Category: Hardware

Garment Perception and Manipulation

My current research is devoted to develop applications in which robots help humans with the laundry and other tasks related to garments and textiles. For that purpose, we are developing new garment perception and manipulation algorithms for different types of robots.

  • More info: Link
  • Category: Research

Modular Robots

As part of my Bachelor's thesis, I researched gait generation and communications in distributed Modular Robots. For testing, I also developed the REPY-2 Module and the SkymegaSMD board to build a Modular Robot to be used as validation platform for the algorithms.

  • More info: Link
  • Category: Research

PyQt / PySide

In this tutorial we will learn how to create a PySide/PyQt application. For that purpose, I will make a walkthrough of the creation of a graphical interface for the PCB outline creator for KiCad. The PCB outline creator is a small tool to add PCB outlines with some given dimensions (and rounded corners) to a KiCad file. It is included in the kicad-library repository.

  • More info: Link
  • Date: November 2015
  • Category: Software
